author: Special Correspondent
text:
Collector V. Rajaraman distributing forms containing pledge to uphold the spirit of a free and fair election to school students in Virudhunagar on Tuesday.

Virudhunagar district administration has chosen to touch the heart of the voters through their children. Collector V. Rajaraman distributed forms containing a pledge to uphold a free, fair and peaceful election to students of Annamalaiammal Girls’ Middle School to make their parents sign them.

The students have been asked to submit the pledge forms signed by the parents to the head of the school.

This activity is part of the Systematic Voters’ Education and Electoral Participation (SVEEP) programme.

The pledge reads: “As citizens of the country having faith in democracy, we would uphold the tradition of the country’s democracy, free, fair and peaceful election, and would take a vow that we would exercise our franchise without fear, influence of religion, race, caste and class and without any kind of inducement.”

Pledge

Mr. Rajaraman said, “The students have to read out the details of the pledge to their parents and get their signature on the forms before submitting them to the head of the school.”

The forms would be distributed to students of all schools.

District Chief Educational Officer Pugalenthi and Tahsildar (Elections) Sridhar were among those who were present.
title: Touching the heart of voters through students
